title: voice mirror pm treated public
story: PM has treated the public with utter contempt - he needs to resignLiar Boris Johnson has nowhere left to hide Image: REX ShutterstockopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Liar Boris Johnson has nowhere left to hide now it has emerged that a Covid lockdown law-breaking birthday party was held for him in Downing Street. Even a fibber as shameless as the charlatan in Number  cannot pretend he did not know a gathering with a cake and a rousing chorus of Happy Birthday by  revellers was a party instead of a work event.What more evidence is required by the police, Sue Gray, Conservative MPs, Parliament and the British people to conclude that Johnson broke the law, lied repeatedly when caught and is totally unfit to lead our nation  The Cabinet room bash in June  – held when families could not say goodbye to dying loved ones, funerals were tightly limited and singing widely banned – will be the final straw for many. Johnson has treated the public with utter contempt, every day he is allowed to remain in office adds insult to injury for those he took for fools. If he had any honour the Prime Minister would resign immediately.  Threat to world BY massing troops on Ukraine’s border in Russia and client state Belarus, ­authoritarian nationalist Vladimir Putin is doing far more than sabre rattling. The threat to unleash Europe’s biggest ­invasion since the end of the Second World War is an aggressive attack on freedom and democracy by a despotic leader. Invade Ukraine and the whole world loses as the economic, political as well as military repercussions will be devastating. Engaging Putin may not trigger sustainable peace but exploring every route to avoiding an invasion is better than fighting one off.  Soap stand-off CORONATION Street and Emmerdale are going head-to-head with EastEnders. The clash for viewers between Weatherfield, The Woolpack and Walford will ide the legion of fans who watch the three soaps. Stakes are high and may the best show win. title: witness claims madeleine mccann suspect
story: Witness claims Madeleine McCann suspect was with her before and after disappearanceThe German witness, who was living in Portugal in , believes Christian Brueckner was miles away from Praia da Luz in Portugal on the day Madeleine McCann went missing from a resort thereChristian Brueckner, the prime suspect Image: REX ShutterstockByMartin FrickerNews ReporterDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Jan A new witness has come forward in the case of missing Madeleine McCann claiming to have been with the prime suspect just before and after she disappeared, it is reported. The new witness reportedly insists Christian Brueckner was calm while she was with him and says they were stopped by police who reported no suspicious activity. The German witness, who was living in Portugal in , believes Brueckner was miles away from Praia da Luz in Portugal on the day Madeleine went missing from a resort there. A source told the Sun: She says she was not with him the day Madel­eine disappeared but spoke with him and again said he seemed normal. The source said: This ­testimony could be an issue.  This comes just days after German journalists who were investigating the case claimed they have uncovered “shocking” evidence which “heavily incriminates” Brueckner. British youngster Madeleine was just three-years-old when she vanished from her parents’ holiday apartment in Portugal in . German prosecutors claim to have evidence she is dead and named convicted paedophile Christian Brueckner as their only suspect. Despite going public with the information in June , they have still not charged him with any offence.  But now a team working for TV channel Sat. have handed the evidence to detectives probing Brueckner over the infamous case. Sat. investigators claim to have found fresh evidence linking Brueckner, who denies any involvement, to the crime. They will reveal more information about their investigation in a prime-time documentary, which is yet to have an air date. Announcing the show, Sat. said journalist Jutta Rabe and a team of reporters gathered new information about Brueckner. They claim it includes proof he was near Praia da Luz when Madeleine vanished while her parents dined in a tapas restaurant. The channel said they collected “many new clues and indications” that corroborate the suspicions of German prosecutors.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Christian BMadeleine MccannMissing persons" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news you-should-never-leave-your-"What to do in the event of a fireByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Jan | commentsA firefighter has issued a stark plea to parents that may help to save the lives of their children. And the trick to doing it is so simple, but is something many parents donapost do as their children might not like it. In a message posted to the Cold Spring Harbor Fire DepartmentFacebook page an emergency responder revealed how shutting a childaposs bedroom door can make all the dference in the event of a house fire. The unnamed firefighter, who is a parent themselves, wrote: As a parent itaposs hard to convince little kids to sleep with the door closed, they always want it open just a little.  I do a lot of fire prevention at schools, so one thing I try and stress to kids is, how important it is to sleep with the doors closed. They go on to explain how there was recently a fire in a neighbouring area and share photos from the blaze - one showing a blackened, charred door, the other showing the back of the door which is still white. The homeowners and family dog are all doing well, they continue. The photos below are a great example of the importance of keeping bedroom doors closed while sleeping. The door pictured in both photos is a hollow core door to a bedroom. While the front of the door is severely damaged the closed door protected the bedroom and its contents. If this were an occupied bedroom the closed door could have saved a le. They added: The cause and origin of the fire are under investigation and believed to be accidental in nature. The post went viral at the time with over , shares more than , likes and hundreds of comments. Many were surprised to learn of the benefits of having a closed door. One person wrote: I close my door so the ghosts donapost come in my room but glad to know there are other benefits! A second said: This is important info, generally unrecognised. A dferent user asked what would happena fire were to start in a bedroom, to which the fire department responded that they should have smoke detectors installed in all common areas in the house - including bedrooms. title: joe biden caught insulting stupid
story: Joe Biden caught insulting stupid news reporter in mortying on-air gaffeUS President Joe Biden was closing a meeting with the press when Fox News reporter Peter Doocy asked about inflation, seemingly irking himUS President Joe Biden was caught insulting news reporter Peter Doocy Image: C-SPANByAntony Thrower:,  Jan | comments US President Joe Biden was caught insulting a news reporter asking about inflation when he did not realise his microphone was still live.President Biden had been hosting a meeting at the East Room of the White House which had come to a close.As the journalists were leaving, several yelled questions at the -year-old, including Fox News reporter Peter Doocy who asked about inflation andit was a political liability.Not realising his mic was still on, the president replied: Thataposs a great asset, more inflation. What a stupid son of a b***h.” Mr Doocy told Sean Hannity on Fox News he had not heard the insult hurled in his direction but within an hour the apologetic president called the reporter personally, saying: It’s nothing personal, pal.  He added: “My reaction was delayed because as you can see the Biden staff were ushering us out. They were telling us thank you, time to go. It wasnapost until we went to the basement and then outside and then back to the press room that somebody said ‘Hey, did you hear what the president said about you  He called you a stupid sobapos. “And I said I did not hear that and I opened up my phone and...he did. “After years of clips of the President and I kind of mixing it up on the campaign trail and during the transition here at The White House, within about an hour of that exchange, he called my cell phone and he just said ‘It is nothing personal, pal.’ “We went back and forth and we were talking about moving forward and I made sure to tell him that Iaposm always going to try to ask something dferent than what everybody  is asking and he said, ‘Youaposve got to.’  “That is the quote from the President, so I will keep doing it.” Joe Biden had earlier spoken about talking to European leaders about the Ukraine crisis. When President Biden took office a year ago he pledged to take a hard line on any disrespect among members of his administration.He said during a virtual swearing-in ceremony: “If youaposre ever working with me and I hear you treat another colleague with disrespect, talk down to someone, I promise you I will fire you on the spot ... no s, ands or buts.Everybody is entitled to be treated with decency and dignity.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Sean HannityJoe BidenFox NewsFoxesInflation" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: i gifted pal winning scratch
story: I gted my pal a winning scratch card - husband is demanding some of the moneyA woman has been left feeling torn after her husband kicked off when her friend won money on a scratch card they gted her - as he thinks they deserve some of the winningsThe woman has been left torn over what to do about the gt Image: Getty Images Mint Images RFByBrogan-Leigh HurstShowbiz Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A woman has landed herself in a dficult situation with her best pal and husband over a winning scratch card. Itaposs an awkward situation that no one wants to find themselves in, but one Mumsnet user revealed it all started over a birthday gt.In a post on the online forum, she began: I always buy a £ scratch card to put in peopleaposs birthday cards. Iaposve been doing this for over a decade. The woman, whose identity is unknown, continued: Last month a good friend won a decent four-figure sum on the scratch card I put in their card.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.She shared her excitement for her pal, but revealed it turned sour when her husband told her she should ask her friend for half of the money, as she purchased the card for them. The user continued: My husband thinks I should ask for half of it because I bought it for them. But in my opinion, I bought the scratch card as a gt and in doing so was opening myself up to the possibility of them winning a lot of money.  If I hadnapost been buying it as a gt I wouldnapost have bought the scratch card so itaposs not like I bought a roll of  and gave them the winning one. My husband and I never argue but heaposs really pushing me to ask on this one. We arenapost rich but we also arenapost struggling so I donapost know why heaposs so insistent that I ask for some of it. Weighing up her options, she added: If it was me I would offer half to the person who bought me the card, but this is because Iaposm fairly financially stable and I donapost know the financial status of this friend but Iaposd suspect its not as good as ours. So am I being unreasonable to just celebrate the win with my friend and not ask her for some of the money  She did say when she told me sheaposd won Weaposll have to go put for a meal, babysitter and dinner on us which I personally thought was lovely. In the comments section of the website, people were backing the woman. I wouldnapost ask, for all the reasons youaposve listed, one person shared. Another wrote: Your husband is crazy. You canapost possibly ask her for half of the money. A third penned: You can’t ask. The scratch card wasn’t the gt, the potential prize was and you can’t ask for half of a gt back. Your husband is a tight b*****d. Begrudging someoneaposs birthday present. Is he normally this mean  a fourth furiously asked. She responded to the anonymous writer: See this is the thing. Heaposs normally not at all! He went to private schoolbut we are nowhere near in that situation for our kids. I really donapost know what he is thinking Iaposve tried to ask why heaposs so upset about it, but he just keeps saying she should at least offer. title: man tinder slammed potential match
story: Man on Tinder slammed by potential match after making clueless joke about ageA man using Tinder has been branded clueless and has been mocked by people online after a potential match on the app shared a look at an immature joke he made to a woman about her ageThe joke backfired on the man as he was mocked onlineImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByBrogan-Leigh HurstShowbiz Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A man using dating app Tinder has been mocked by people on the internet after he made an immature joke to a potential match.The unknown man connected with a woman who had celebrated her birthday the day before they matched - and he made a distasteful joke about her age - which backfired on him.Taking to Reddit, he shared a screenshot of their conversation, asking othershe had been a douche or did she blow up at me for no reason.The snippets shared online saw a message from him asking: What are you now  right  The woman says: Yepp, as of yesterday.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.He responded: Another year closer to those senior citizen discounts. The woman didnapost find his comment funny, penning back: You can use this as a learning opportunity. I am completely secure in my age but saying that sort of thing to ANY woman will not go well. By saying it, I realise you may be too immature for me. Thank you and have a great night. He didnapost let the conversation stop there, and went back for more. You don’t like jokes  he questioned.  The man added: aposI am completely secure in my age!’ Proceeds to have complete meltdown over age joke. Yea I’m pretty sure that means you aren’t secure and there’s some insecurities there. Anyone  would play that joke off and get me back with something funny but you nearly had a breakdown. He added in his Reddit post that the woman didnapost respond after he replied to her. Other users slammed the man for lacking basic social skills, as they didnapost find his remarks funny either. All you had to do was say happy birthday, one person told him. A second penned: Hilarious you say she had a meltdown as you behave the exact same way. A third said: She literally told you it was her birthday and instead of saying ‘happy birthday’ or ‘did you get any cool gts’ you made a rude joke about her age. Another urged the man to be nice as they wrote: That’s the type of joke you make when you’re dating and super comfortable around one another. Be nice and tell her she looks gorgeous or do the ole ‘damn I honestly thought you were ’. Nothing beats knocking a few years off her age … she will love you after that. Try being nice. It goes a long way.What do you think  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TinderDatingViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum left feeling irritated message
story: Mum left feeling irritated by message on child-free wedding invite from friendA mum was left irritated by an invite which gave parents the golden opportunity for a child-free night, as she claimed the bride and groom dressed it up as a favourMum left feeling irritated by message on child-free wedding inviteImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByBrogan-Leigh HurstShowbiz Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A doting mum was left mildly irritated by a child-free wedding invite as she disliked the wording. Whilst Mumsnet user JukEki was thrilled to be invited along to two weddings in June, she couldnapost help but disagree with how the message had been sugar-coated to seem like it is a night off from childcare for parents.Taking to the website, she created a thread which was titled, aposTo be irritated by this wedding invite apos and ranted to anonymous users online. She began: We have been invited to two child-free weddings, both in June. We are going to attend both and are pulling in favours for childcare.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.However I can’t pretend that I’m not mildly irritated by the wording in one of the invites! Detailing what both invites said, she continued: One invite said, aposUnfortunately bearing in mind we have limited guest numbers we cannot accommodate everyone’s children however this is a golden opportunity for parents to enjoy a night of relaxation and uninhibited revelry!apos The second simply said, aposWhilst we love your children please note this is an adult-only occasion. But it was the first invite that didnapost sit right with the mum, who went on to list of her reasons for frustration.  She added to her post: The first annoyed me as actually it’s not going to be relaxing for me in the slightest, it’s quite inconvenient and expensive to not be able to bring the children and I’m more likely to be hand expressing in the toilets than dancing on a table. It is absolutely the couple’s prerogative to have the wedding they want including making a decision to have no children - just own it and say so instead of dancing around it and pretending it’s a night off for me. She concluded: Happy to be told I’m unreasonable - first also contained a money poem which may be biasing me. Thankfully, other users agreed with her and agreed that there was no need for the bride and groom to dress up the invite as a favour. One person commented: I agree with you. I hate it when they try to pass it off as doing the guests a favour. Itaposs a nuisance and an expense sorting childcare. I think the second wording is much better. Iaposm all for child-free weddings, but as you say, just be frank about and donapost dress it up as a favour. Another shared: Not unreasonable at all, and yes the appropriate response is ‘irritated’.They are trying to put a positive spin on their decision, but it comes across as patronising. It’s also the babysitter that is allowing you to be child-free for a night, not the wedding. However, it sounds as though it is well-meant and they just haven’t had the opportunity to know what they are talking about.It’s also one of those things people say at this kind of event when they have young children “oh it’s great to have a night off”. It’s true, and it’s a polite thing to say, but it glosses over the effort involved. They have probably heard this before and taken it completely at face value.A third concluded: Agree with you. For us, we like to spend weekends with our children, have no local childcare and I would pass on the “golden opportunity” to pay £ for childcare to attend someone’s wedding. I am from a country where I have never heard of or been to a child-free wedding. Children are accepted as part of le and families.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: baby turns blue after dad
story: Baby turns blue after dad took Covid advice from conspiracy theorists onlineInstead of turning to medical professionals, the dad asked an online conspiracy theory group for health advice after his daughter likely caught covidA father from the US gave his daughter a medication meant for head lice, when he was worried she had Covid Image: Getty Images Cavan Images RFByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A baby turned blue after her dad took Covid health advice from a conspiracy theory online group.Jason became concerned when his six-month-old daughter Ruby began experiencing flu-like symptoms a week after her mother had tested positive for Covid. Instead of taking her to a hospital or doctor, Jason consulted a QAnon Telegram group chat with tens of thousands of people who think Covid is a hoax. Vice reported the conversation that followed.Jason wrote in the group: “Do you guys think it’s safe to give ivermectin to an infant ”Ivermectin is an antiparasitic medicine used to treat infestations in humans including head lice.  Two years ago researchers claimed it could kill off the virus which causes Covid, but there is no clinical evidence to support this and it is widely accepted amongst medical professionals that it should not be taken. The group however, was not medical professionals and they had spent months sharing tips on how best to obtain the drug. One group member responded: “Baby aspirin to thin the blood a little and drop any fever and I would put some ivermectin on the bottoms of her feet,”  Other conspiracy theorists on the chat said he should wait to take advice from “experts” in ivermectin, in the group. One so-called ‘expert’ called Katie said: “From what I understand, yes it is safe to give to an infant, however please stop calling it Covid, it’s not Covid, it’s a simple cold. That’s how we got in this mess to begin with.” Jason took the advice and gave his baby a dose of ivermectin. “We gave her two doses of ivermectin at mg each. That’s what was recommended by someone on here. She got really sick after that. Related  I don’t know.” Jason said. Within minutes Jason said that his little girl’s condition was worsening. He said: “Baby threw up. Is that common side effect  She’s also turning a tad blue.” Someone  said this exact thing had happened to their child, and that they then took their child to hospital.Jason said: “We don’t trust hospitals. I told my son to give her more ivermectin.”Group members begged Jason to take his daughter to hospital. One member called Barbara said: “That baby needs to go to the ER. Do not hesitate. “I’ve seen too many go south due to O levels being low. The blue is hypoxia and that’s lack of oxygen at the tissue level. Please!”  Jason eventually told the group he had taken his child to hospital. “[My] son is taking baby to urgent care. Against my wishes but I’m praying for her. It’s in God’s hands now.” He later said she was “doing better”. He added: “God knew what to do even though I thought hospital was certain death. Thanks for everyone’s advice.” The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  The US isn’t the only place where conspiracy theorists have been trying to get ahold of the drug. In Australia, the Therapeutics Goods Administrationhas placed restrictions on the prescribing of oral ivermectin amid a spike in demand.The TGA said: “These changes have been introduced because of concerns with the prescribing of oral ivermectin for the claimed prevention or treatment of Covid-.“Ivermectin is not approved for use in Covid- in Australia or in other developed countries, and its use by the general public for Covid- is currently strongly discouraged by the National COVID Clinical Evidence Taskforce, the World Health Organisation and the US Food and Drug Administration.” “Firstly, there are a number of signicant public health risks associated with taking ivermectin in an attempt to prevent Covid- infection rather than getting vaccinated,” it said. “Iniduals who believe that they are protected from infection by taking ivermectin may choose not to get tested or to seek medical carethey experience symptoms. Doing so has the potential to spread the risk of Covid- infection throughout the community. “Secondly, the doses of ivermectin that are being advocated for use in unreliable social media posts and other sources for Covid- are signicantly higher than those approved and found safe for scabies or parasite treatment. “These higher doses can be associated with serious adverse effects, including severe nausea, vomiting, dizziness, neurological effects such as dizziness, seizures and coma. “Finally, there has been a --fold increased dispensing of ivermectin prescriptions in recent months, leading to national and local shortages for those who need the medicine for scabies and parasite infections. “It is believed that this is due to recent prescribing and dispensing for unapproved uses, such as Covid-. Such shortages can disproportionately impact vulnerable people, including those in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON World Health OrganisationERBabiesHospitalsCoronavirus" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: brit couple face nervous wait
story: Brit couple face nervous wait for surrogate babys passports amid Ukraine tensionsBen and Alice Garratt, who moved from London to Kyiv, Ukraine, in December, said the wait to get their son Raphaels paperwork completed is "more nerve-racking" as embassy staff flee amid fears of a Russian invasionBen Garratt and his month-old baby, Raphael Image: PAByLily FordRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan | comments A British couple living in Ukraine while their surrogate-born baby is issued a passport have described their nerve-racking wait amid mounting tensions between Russia and Ukraine. The threat of a Russian invasion has put Nato forces on standby and led the Foreign Office to begin withdrawing some staff and dependents from the embassy in Kyiv - where some British expats said they have bags packed ready to go west.Ben Garratt and his we, Alice, live in Queenaposs Park in London but moved to the Ukrainian capital at the end of the December to meet their baby and oversee official paperwork. Ukraine has very dferent surrogacy laws to the UK which means that itaposs much easier to work with an IVF clinic and a surrogacy agency here to have a baby that way... so Ukraine is an international hub of people coming for surrogacy services, Mr Garratt, , said. Weaposve always known that it would be a load of paperwork once he was born, for us to bring him home - but obviously, what was going to be a period of potential boredom, waiting in an apartment in Kyiv for two or three months, is now more nerve-racking. Unless we can get a passport for Raphael in the conventional way, orthat becomes impossible, the British Embassy get to the point they can give Raphael an emergency passport, we canapost leave - so it is nerve-racking.  Thanks to the process of getting a passport for new-born Raphael, the couple were always planning to be in Kyiv until mid-March. Despite international concerns of impending conflict between Ukraine and Russia, Mr Garratt, who works in stakeholder engagement at London North Eastern Railway, said Kyiv feels completely normal. Itaposs really strange...like Oxford Street on a Saturday... except for the snow, he said. It looks normal. Looking out the window... itaposs buzzing... thereaposs no evidence of panic buying, thereaposs no queues anywhere.  Iaposve never been in a country thataposs been invaded, I donapost know what that feels like, but it feels bizarre that it could happen . He and his we continue to keep in contact with friends and family who are nervous on their behalf. Weaposre nervous on their behalf, weaposre nervous because theyaposre nervous... thereaposs a lot of nervousness spreading through the family, he said. I guess there is a point at which we think, well, aposletaposs just go and seewe can cross a border and get to the UKapos... I donapost think weaposre anywhere near that and Iaposd be really surprised, Iaposd hope the British government wouldnapost let it get to that stage.  Jez Myers, a business consultant who has split his time between Manchester and Kyiv since , said while he is planning toto the city in mid-February, the major concern for many is the possibility of a cyber-attack. If a cyber attack happens, yougot to be concerned about heating, electricity, and cash, the -year-old said. Finding somewhere you can escape to, so: bag packed, clothing, water, chargers, grab your bag and get west...the mantra that most people are adopting. But news of embassy staff leaving is not a concern for Mr Myers.  Itaposs taking precautionary measures... my plan is toin middle of February as scheduled, he said. An IT director from Glasgow said has no intention of leaving his we and son in Ukraine as he maintains all is well. If the tanks roll and they are on the streets, that will bepain...I have no intention of leaving the flat we bought here, George, who has lived in Ukraine for more than two years and did not wish to have his second name included, told PA.are just being cautious... we live normally in Kyiv for now. news world-news crazed-wild-monkeys-filmed-vandalising-"Monkeys vandalise cars outside Buddhist temple in ThailandByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments This is the unbelievable moment crazed wild monkeys vandalised touristsapos cars that were parked outside a Buddhist temple. The troop of more than  primates were seen climbing over the vehicles, which were parked opposite the historical San Phra Kan shrine in Lopburi province in Thailand on January .Incredible footage shows the Simians dragging, biting, and ripping the rubber trim off of a pickup truck in an attempt to access the vehicle. Then another group of monkeys were seen trying to break into a black sedan that was parked next to it. Staff say that holidaymakers who leave their cars unattended are at risk of having the vehicles damaged.  These primates are known to swarm the vehicles - which may be rental cars - within minutes.Tourists are advised to park their cars further away. They are also meant to contact the local staffthe animals are stopping them from driving away.Panot Bunsi, one of the drivers whose car was damaged, claims there are now warnings about the wild animals.  The annoyed tourist said: I knew the monkeys pester people for food but I didnapost know they also attack cars. If someone told me before ofthere were warning signs, I would not have left my car. In March , the monkeys had an astonishing mass brawl over scraps of food. In February , dozens of monkeys took over a schoolaposs swimming pool and rummaged through the bins in search of food. Residents believe the monkeys brings good luck to the city.  Many of the monkeys congregate around an ancient Buddhist temple, but they have also taken over a cinema - forcing the previous owner to move out and close the business. Government officials have tried to control the monkey population without success.In , large numbers of monkeys were sterilised after their numbers spiralled out of control during the coronavirus lockdown, with well-meaning locals feeding them sugary drinks.Environmental officer Narongporn Daudduem said the department has a long-term plan to build a sanctuary in another part of the city, but plans are likely to be met with resistance from some of the residents who donapost want the monkeys living near them. title: man left hungry after delivery
story: Man left hungry after delivery driver ate meal and left nasty note when he didnt tipMykul Myas said he waited  minutes for his Mexican food to arrive but instead of getting his meal he was met with an empty bowl and a nasty noteMykul Myas says he was left a note instead of his food Image: Mykul Myas   CATERS NEWSByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA man claims he was left hungry after his food delivery driver allegedly ate his meal then left him a nasty note after he didn’t leave a tip. Mykul Myas said decided to order in some Mexican food so he could enjoy his cravings in the comfort of his own home. The -year-old from Baltimore, Maryland, USA, said he waited  minutes for his £. burrito bowl, but after going to eat his meal, he was shocked at what he found. Mykul claims his dinner had been completely polished off by the driver, who also left a nasty note stating that he had eaten his food because he did not receive a tip. The carpenter said: “I had a craving for Mexican food and I didn’t really want to go out and get it. “I decided to get it delivered. I ordered a burrito bowl and waited about  minutes.  “I then got a notication saying it was at my door, so I went to check and the bag had just been left there. “I didn’t actually see the person. I was planning to give him a tip in cash, but he drove away before I’d even had a chance. “I couldn’t believe it when I opened the box up to eat my food, and it was all gone. I was in total disbelief, and then to see that note there, it felt really personal. I honestly thought it was someone pulling my leg. I was disappointed, as I was really looking forward to the meal. I ended up just having some ramen noodles after that.” The anonymous note was left in the eaten bowl and read: “Leave a tip next time and this might not happen. “And don’t bother tryna [sic] get me fired. Going back to Amazon.” Shocked Mykul said he could not believe what had happened, adding that he had put some cash aside to give the driver a tip, but they had driven away before he got a chance.Mykul says he has also received an influx of cruel hate comments from strangers around the world after posting the photograph to Facebook, where it has since gone viral.He said: “I’m guessing the driver was just angry about me not leaving a tip in the app, so they decided to eat my food and leave that note. “After reading people’s comments, they were telling me that most delivery drivers make their money off tips. But I had no idea. “I was getting a lot of hate comments about not leaving a tip through the app. ButI had seen the person, I would have given them a cash tip, that was my plan. “People were telling me I got what I deserved and that I’m disgusting. Random strangers have been flooding my inbox with angry messages. “Half the people were laughing that it happened, and the other half were angry.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Food" data-immediate"data-immediate"Serve the food you really want to eat by signing up for our tips and recipes and never be bored by your cooking againSign UpInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mystery vast water lake mars
story: Mystery of vast water lake on Mars may have finally been solved, study claimsMystery has surrounded what appeared to be "vast water lakes" on the south pole of Mars that were discovered during a  study but now scientists believe they may have the answerScientists believe they have answer over vast lakes on Mars Image: Getty Images Science Photo Library RFByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments Scientists puzzled by the appearance of a vast lake of water on Marsapos ice covered south pole believe they could have come up with the answer in a new study.Research in  led to the belief that bright reflections under the polar cap could be water but now scientists claim that it was just an illusion. Further investigation shows that the reflections match those of volcanic plains found all across the red planet. It solves the mystery as current temperature and pressure makes stable liquid water unlikely at the planetaposs surface, researchers have said.Scientists at the University of Texas at Austin believe that it could have been volcanic rock buried under ice that was seen in the  study. Lead author, Cyril Grima, a planetary scientist at the University of Texas Institute for Geophysics , said: For water to be sustained this close to the surface, you need both a very salty environment and a strong, locally generated heat source, but that doesnapost match what we know of this region. The south polar mirage dissolved when scientists added an imaginary global ice sheet across a radar map of Mars. They found that the imaginary ice showed how the planet would appear when looked at through a mile of ice and this allowed them to compare features across the entire planet with those under the polar cap. Mr Grima noticed bright reflections, just like those seen in the south pole but scattered across the planet. And many matched the location of volcanic plains. Iron-rich lava flows on Earth can leave behind rocks that produce similar reflections and scientists suggest other possibilities include mineral deposits in dried riverbeds.  But eventhere is no liquid water on Mars, there is plenty of ice on the planet. Isaac Smith, a Mars geophysicist at York University, believes the bright radar signatures are a kind of clay made when rock erodes in water. He said: I think the beauty of Cyril Grimaaposs finding is that while it knocks down the idea there might be liquid water under the planetaposs south pole today, it also gives us really precise places to go look for evidence of ancient lakes and riverbeds and test hypotheses about the wider drying out of Marsapos climate over billions of years. The study, published in the journal Geophysical Research Letters, is based on three years of data from Marsis, a radar instrument launched in  aboard the European Space Agencyaposs Mars Express. news world-news nephew-who-took-uncles-corpse-"Carlow: Man unknowingly takes his dead uncle to post officeByPaul HealyRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan A man who took his uncleaposs corpse to the post office to collect his pension claims he didnapost know he was dead at the time. Declan Haughney, , insists that he was not trying to rob his deceased relative Peadar Doyle, , after he and another man dragged him for five minutes from his home to collect his pension from a Post Office in Hoseys, Ireland last Friday morning.Declan, , told the Irish Mirror he’s now “the talk of the town” and has been branded a “murderer” in the local community ever since the sensational story emerged. But he insisted he’s “not an eejit” – and believes he’s being accused of dragging his dead uncle into a post office to rob his pension – because he previously stole from his aunt. He said: “Why would I want to rob my uncle  I’m  years of age yeah, I’m not a child, I’m not a young fella. I’m not an eejit to walk into Hoseys with a dead man and collect his money. Am I cuckoo  Am I cuckoo  I’m not.”  Declan, who admits he used to have a drug problem, and who served two years in prison, says he’s now being accused of knowingly bringing his dead uncle in to get his pension – because of his past. He told us: “That’s why they’re saying it, that’s why this is all coming up now – because I done it before. A bank card came through the aunt’s door and I got the pin code and went down for fraud and that’s why this is all coming up. “People know about that in the town you know. But that was  years ago. I’m off the gear three years and I’m doing well.”  And Declan, who has a black eye and facial injuries after allegedly being attacked following the incident last Friday, revealed that he now believes his uncle was dead before he even reached the post office. Declan says he believes Peadar may have been dead by the time he and another male got him under the bridge at Pollerton Road, which is less than a two-minute walk from his home – but the pair continued to bring him to the post office by linking arms with him and dragging him there.  When the pair propped Mr Doyle up against the counter a member of staff contacted the Irish gardai.Both men, one of whom is said to have known Mr Doyle ‘very well’, have since made full statements to the police investigating the incident from Friday.  Officers believe he may have died around three hours before his impromptu trip to Hosey’s newsagents and post office in Carlow with the men, despite the claims that he was alive. Fr John Dunphy, the priest who delivered the last rites to Mt Doyle, said he received a call from police saying his remains had been left at the shop in ‘shocking circumstances.’ Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Post OfficePensionsCrimeFunerals" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news world-news real-le-rapunzel-who-started-"Real le Rapunzels hair turned grey when she was ByPesala BandaraDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA aposreal-le Rapunzelapos who first started going grey when she was just thirteen years old has learned to embrace her ft long silver locks.Anna Shepherd, , says she was devastated and self-conscious when she started getting grey hair as a teen and was cruelly teased about it. But over the years she has learned to love her grey hair and says she only needs to wash it once a month, making her le as a farmer easier. Anna, who lives in Hungary, says she sometimes only combs her knee- hair once a week when she’s busy working and explains how low maintenance it is.She says she feels honoured when she hears others being inspired not to dye their greys after seeing her hair. Anna proudly shares snaps of her stunning silver locks with her , followers on Instagram– although she has received some strange requests from men. Anna – who has over one million views on her haircare video – says: “It may partly be genetics, but I only wash my hair once a month because that’s how it behaves best. “And I don’t apply anything to my hair except some oil after I wash it to tame it and keep it manageable. “It’s honestly easier having long hair on the farm because you don’t have to style it and you can put it up in a bun. “Sometimes when I’m doing a lot of physical work on the farm, I can go for a week without brushing it and it’s fine. “‘I used to get picked on or stared at for my grey hair as a teenager but now I only get compliments. “I feel honoured when women write to me saying that they’ve found the courage to go grey because of me. It fills my heart with happiness. “There’s definitely a stigma with a young woman having grey hair and I would love to help change that. “However I will admit that I do get some strange requests from men online. A male follower offered to pay to lick my grey hair! I was lost for words.” Anna says that she was distraught when she started getting grey hair. She recalls: “I begged my mother to let me dye my hair when I began going grey. I was so sad and worried that I would look old. “I felt extremely self-conscious all the time. People would stare at my strands of grey hair and I would get remarks about it.  “I remember this incident when a boy called me ‘Cruella’ and it did hurt my feelings. “But over time, I learned to love my grey hair and it became an extension of myself.” Anna says she was inspired to grow her locks after reading folklore and she hasn’t had a proper haircut since she was  years old.  Anna, who works as a regenerative farmer with her boyfriend, explains: “I joined a folk-dance group as a teenager and became inspired by folklore imagery and women of history with beautul floor- hair. I wanted to emulate their hair and started growing it. “The last time I had a proper haircut was when I was fourteen years old. I went to the hairdresser and asked for a trim but the hairdresser chopped off far too much. “Since then I have never been back to the hairdresser. If I ever need to, I just ask my mother to give me a trim but that’s only once in a few years.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TeenagersHairstyles" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman donates kidney boyfriend who
story: Woman donates kidney to boyfriend who then cheats and brutally dumps her after opColleen Le, , told of her trauma after volunteering to give one of her kidneys to her boyfriend who had chronic kidney disease and needed a transplant at Colleen Le donated a kidney to her boyfriend who then dumped her, she allegesByLaura SharmanFreelance writer:,  Jan | commentsA woman who donated a kidney to her boyfriend claims he cheated and dumped her just months after the operation. Colleen Le, , said she offered to give her then boyfriend one of her kidneys because he was struggling to live with chronic kidney disease as a teenager. At just  years old, the unnamed man had to have dialysis treatment and told her his kidney was ing at less than five per cent. Colleen, from the US, says she made the decision to donate after a test showed the young couple were a match and they both made a full recovery following the successful procedure.But just ten months later, she claims he called things off after being unfaithful to her and accused her of going ahead with the transplant to look good. Colleen has gone viral on TikTok where she talks about her brutal allegations under the name @colleeeniie and has gained more than two million likes.  In one video, she said: I decided to get tested to seewe were a match because I didnapost want to watch him die. I was so nervous. In a later clip, Colleen explained that the coupleaposs relationship changed with her boyfriend claiming he was going to a bachelor party in Vegas with his church group seven months after the operation. The student said she was not concerned about the weekend getaway because he was a devoted Christian and that she decided to focus on studying for her exams. But she says she was shocked when he arrived home and admitted to cheating on her during the trip. A lot of arguments later, I eventually forgave him and gave him a second chance, Colleen said. But another three months later, he ended the relationship and saidwe are meant for each other, God will bring us back together in the end. In a further blow, Colleen claims he blocked her on all social media s and she now shares her heartbreak on TikTok. Many of her followers commended the student for saving her ex boyfriendaposs le and said he did not deserve her. Others criticised her for still telling her story years after the devastating events unravelled. One person commented: You have the biggest heart and he didn’t see it. His loss. Another person said: You deserve so much better, Iaposm so sorry this happened.Colleenaposs story echoes that of TikToker Uziel Martínez who claims he was dumped by his girlfriend weeks after donating his kidney to her mum.The teacher, from Baja Calornia, Mexico, told how his heroic move was not enough to save his relationship and that his ex has since married another man. Since his ordeal, he has also made several TikToks about the nightmare breakup as part of a recent trend. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. title: arable issues to the fore at northern crop conference
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. title: walkers shortbread new managing director
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles. title: what to expect from nicola sturgeons covid update today
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place.You can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Yes, we will still send you a daily ePaper reminder with a link to the Evening Express ePaper, every time there is a new ePaper available .No, the Evening Express ePaper app will remain exactly the same.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through the PJ website here.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on the PJ website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.Yes, your existing Evening Express login details work on The Press and Journal. To log in please visit www.pressandjournal login.If you have any problems logging in, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on  , or email.When you purchased your subscription, an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.No, your existing reoccurring billing agreement will not change. If you cancel this agreement you can still purchase a new subscription in the future through The Press and Journal website. The price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription.If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscription Team   , or email.Please contact our Digital News Subscription Team on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The Evening Express website is no longer available. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a PJ Web or PJ ePaper subscription here: www.pressandjournal subscribeThe Evening Express ePaper subscription is still available for purchase here.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.No, there is only one Web subscription available on The Press and Journal. The Press and Journal Web subscription will give you access to all content on site from The PJ and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. Please call on    Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.You can purchase an Evening Express ePaper subscription here.Yes, you can. Our ePapers are an exact digital replica of the newspaper and carry unique content in both titles.
